column4: Is it possible to enable 'remote desktop' for ubuntu fron an SSH session?
yes
did you enable X forwarding in your sshd.conf ?
then run something like: ssh -XC wherever
What commanddo I run to get to the gdm config screen?
you want to enable vnc right?
compession
run: vino-preferences
Awesome, thanks!!
Well it didnt work..
what didn't?
try: ssh -YC
if you just need to run an app, ssh -YC will work pretty reliably
thanks, I need to run a terminal window on the desktop so I can leave it running when I disconnect
screen
you're trying (in a roundabout way) to emulate the functionality of screen
Im actually trying to setup my mythtv box thats at home while at work. :)
I was able to VNC this box before Ireinstalled Edgy
how far away is this computer?
and your router is configured to forward the right ports?
I shouldntneed to restart gdm should I?
that's not part of gdm, and afaik vino starts up immediately after you enable it
kill -1 pid, then try kill -9 pid
